meanings.def: the direction that you look towards to see the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
examples: Which way is east?
A gale was blowing from the east.
to the east (of…) a town to the east of (= further east than) Chicago
The train line facilitates travel between east and west.

meanings.def: the eastern part of a country, region or city
examples: The east of the country is especially popular with tourists.
Around 2 000 teachers from around the East of England attended the conference.
in the east I was born in the East, but now live in San Francisco.
Elsewhere in the East, wet, unsettled weather will continue until the weekend.
House prices in the east have risen significantly over the last five years.
There's been a severe earthquake in the east of the country.

meanings.def: the countries of Asia, especially China, Japan and India
examples: European traders started trading with the East in the 15th century.

meanings.def: the Communist countries of Central and Eastern Europe
examples: the centrally planned system of the East
East–West relations
East Africa
They live on the east coast.
the east bank of the river
They live on the city's east side.
The park and lake are at the east end of the complex.

meanings.def: an east wind blows from the east

examples: The house faces east.
The storm is expected to head east.

meanings.def: nearer to the east than something
examples: They live five miles east of Oxford.
